[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/chunky/mod.rs] [Module: input_secret] [Struct: InputSecret] [Secret visibility] Is the SilentDebug/SilentDisplay sufficient to prevent secrets from being logged or printed accidentally? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/chunky/mod.rs] [Module: input_secret] [Function: generate()] [Randomness quality] Does sample_field_element provide cryptographically secure randomness for secret generation? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/chunky/mod.rs] [Module: input_secret] [Function: add_assign()] [Overflow handling] Can adding two InputSecrets cause field overflow, and is it handled correctly? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/chunky/mod.rs] [Module: input_secret] [Function: zero()] [Zero secret] Can a zero secret be dealt, and does this break threshold cryptography security? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/chunky/mod.rs] [Module: input_secret] [Function: get_secret_a()] [Reference safety] Does returning a reference to the secret prevent it from being cloned, or can it still be extracted? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/chunky/mod.rs] [Module: input_secret] [Static assertion] [Clone prevention] Is the assert_not_impl_any!(InputSecret: Clone) check sufficient, or can unsafe code bypass it? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/chunky/mod.rs] [Module structure] [Re-export safety] Does re-exporting only Transcript hide critical implementation details that could be exploited if exposed? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/chunky/mod.rs] [Module: weighted_transcript] [TODO comment] Is the commented-out weighted_transcript module a security concern if added later without proper review? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/chunky/mod.rs] [Cross-module] [Type consistency] Are all E: Pairing type parameters consistent across modules, or can type confusion occur at module boundaries? (Medium)
[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/chunky/mod.rs] [Cross-module] [Visibility] Do the pub(crate) and pub use declarations properly encapsulate internal implementation details? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/chunky/mod.rs] [Module: transcript] [Cryptographic soundness] Can an adversary who controls <1/3 of dealers create transcripts that reconstruct to a different secret than honest dealers intended? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/chunky/mod.rs] [Module: transcript] [Threshold manipulation] Can colluding dealers distribute shares such that fewer than threshold t parties can reconstruct the secret? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/chunky/mod.rs] [Module: transcript] [SCRAPE attack] Can an attacker craft polynomial evaluations that pass the Low Degree Test but are not evaluations of a degree t-1 polynomial? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/chunky/mod.rs] [Module: chunked_elgamal] [CCA security] Is the chunked ElGamal scheme CCA-secure, or can an attacker modify ciphertexts and observe decryption results to learn secrets? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/chunky/mod.rs] [Module: chunked_elgamal] [Related message attack] If the same randomness is reused across multiple encryptions, can an attacker learn relationships between plaintexts? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/chunky/mod.rs] [Module: hkzg_chunked_elgamal] [Proof extraction] Can an adversary extract witness information from the sigma protocol proof, compromising zero-knowledge property? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/chunky/mod.rs] [Module: transcript] [Pairing attack] Can an attacker find alternative (Cs, Rs, Vs) tuples that satisfy the pairing equation e(weighted_Cs, H) = e(G, weighted_Vs) but don't represent valid shares? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/chunky/mod.rs] [Module: transcript] [Fiat-Shamir] Is the Fiat-Shamir transform applied to the sigma protocol secure against adaptive attacks where adversary sees multiple proofs? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/chunky/mod.rs] [Module: chunks] [Bit manipulation] Can an attacker manipulate individual bits in chunks to cause subtle corruption that passes verification but produces wrong secrets? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/chunky/mod.rs] [Module: transcript] [Multi-pairing optimization] Does using multi_pairing instead of separate pairings introduce side-channel vulnerabilities or timing attacks? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/chunky/mod.rs] [Module: transcript] [Dealer identification] Can a malicious dealer create transcripts that are valid but don't properly identify the dealer, allowing impersonation? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/chunky/mod.rs] [Module: transcript] [Share consistency] In a multi-dealer DKG, can inconsistent shares from different dealers cause reconstruction to fail or produce wrong keys? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/chunky/mod.rs] [Module: transcript] [Aggregation attack] When aggregating transcripts from multiple dealers, can a malicious dealer cause the aggregation to fail for honest parties? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/chunky/mod.rs] [Module: keys] [Key extraction] After DKG completes, can an adversary who sees dealt public keys and public key shares work backwards to learn decryption keys? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/chunky/mod.rs] [Module: transcript] [Verification bypass] Can an attacker create a transcript that fails verification for honest nodes but succeeds for nodes with slightly different implementations? (High)
